description: Anomaly statistic dashboard for VictoriaMetrics Anomaly Detection (vmanomaly) v1.18.4 or higher

links.title: Dashboard Guide
links.tooltip: Follow to `vmanomaly` docs to see detailed guide on how to operate this dashboard

panels.description: This section highlights hints to make full use of the dashboard

options.content:
This dashboard shows **[anomaly score](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score)** statistics produced by [`vmanomaly`](https://victoriametrics.com/products/enterprise/anomaly-detection/) and stored in "${DS_VM:text}" datasource. Timezone: `$__timezone`
#### Usage Hints: - Hover over the **(i) icons** in the top-right corner of each visualization and variable to see a detailed description of its specifics. - **Dashboard-level filters** apply to all visualizations. - The most generic filters are already added, e.g. `model_alias`, `scheduler_alias`,
which are the labels that all `anomaly_score` metrics have by default - To filter on one or more labels, use `Ad hoc filters` [ad hoc Grafana filter](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/dashboards/use-dashboards/#filter-dashboard-data). - Adjust `Metrics prefix` (current = `${vmanomaly_prefix}`) according to output format, defined in `writer.metric_format` [config section](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/writer/?highlight=metric_format#config-parameters) - e.g. if your `writer.metric_format.__name__` was set to `vmanomaly_$VAR`, set the prefix to `vmanomaly_` string. - The **`Group by`** dashboard filter allows you to segment visualizations based on selected labels. - For example, setting it to `model_alias` will create separate sub-visualizations for each unique model alias. - This helps in analyzing anomaly patterns across different dimensions. - The **`Threshold`** dashboard constant (default: `1.0`, current: `$anomaly_score_threshold`) determines anomaly classification: - **Non-anomalous** data points: `anomaly_score` â‰¤ `Threshold` - **Anomalous** data points: `anomaly_score` > `Threshold` - Set the threshold value consistently with your **alerting rules** for accurate anomaly detection. - The **`Min Anomaly%`** dashboard constant helps to filter the visualizations in **Local Anomaly Score Statistics** dashboard section,
leaving only timeseries with % of anomalies over time > selected value (`$anomaly_share`%) - The **`Show series`** dashboard custom multi-valued list allows to specify what [vmanomaly output](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/models/#vmanomaly-output) series
to plot on "local anomaly score statistics" dashboard sections
(defaults to `y` - raw metric values model saw during prediction phase)

panels.description: This section presents aggregated (by `$groupby`) **[anomaly score](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score)** statistics for active instances of [VictoriaMetrics Anomaly Detection](https://victoriametrics.com/products/enterprise/anomaly-detection/) (`vmanomaly`).

options.content:
This section presents aggregated (by `${groupby}`) **[anomaly score](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score)** statistics for active instances of [VictoriaMetrics Anomaly Detection](https://victoriametrics.com/products/enterprise/anomaly-detection/) (`vmanomaly`).
`Min.Anomaly%` filter **doesn't affect** the results of this section.

panels.description: Statistics (min, max, quantiles, share and cnt of scores > `Threshold`=`$anomaly_score_threshold`) for [anomaly scores](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score), given dashboard-level filters and (optional) `Group by`=`$groupby` grouping applied as additional columns, if set
panels.title: Anomaly Score Statistics, grouped by `$groupby`

panels.description: % of anomalous data points over selected time range, given anomaly threshold `Threshold`=`$anomaly_score_threshold` and the other dashboard-level filters.
panels.title: % of Anomalies over time (threshold = $anomaly_score_threshold), grouped by `$groupby`

panels.description: Distribution of [anomaly scores](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score) over selected time range, given anomaly threshold `Threshold` and the other dashboard-level filters.
panels.title: Anomaly score (> $anomaly_score_threshold) distribution, grouped by `$groupby`

panels.description: 99th quantile anomaly score over selected time range, given anomaly `Threshold`=`$anomaly_score_threshold` and the other dashboard-level filters.
panels.title: q99 anomaly score over time (threshold = $anomaly_score_threshold), grouped by `$groupby`

panels.description: This section holds raw (timeseries-wise) **[anomaly score](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score)** statistics for active instances of [VictoriaMetrics Anomaly Detection](https://victoriametrics.com/products/enterprise/anomaly-detection/) (`vmanomaly`).

options.content:
This section holds raw (timeseries-wise) **[anomaly score](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score)** statistics produced by [VictoriaMetrics Anomaly Detection](https://victoriametrics.com/products/enterprise/anomaly-detection/) (`vmanomaly`).
`Min.Anomaly%` filter affect the results of this section.

panels.description: This table holds the labelset and the respective anomaly% (share of raw datapoints over a selected time range that have anomaly score > `Threshold` = `$anomaly_score_threshold`) for individual timeseries, additionally filtered by min anomaly  filter = `$anomaly_share` %
panels.title: Anomalous Time Series

panels.description: [Anomaly scores](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score) over time for individual timeseries, given dashboard filters
panels.title: Anomalous Time Series

panels.description:
Raw metric values which correspond to generated above [anomaly scores](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score) for easier debugging. Different series from [vmanomaly output](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/models/#vmanomaly-output) can be shown, including `y` (raw metric value model saw at prediction time), `yhat` (model predictions), `yhat_lower` and `yhat_upper` (respective model predictions' boundaries).

**Note:** This panel works only if `writer.metric_format.for` was properly set in `vmanomaly` config + `provide_series` arg of respective [model](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/models/#provide-series) included `y` column, so for each timeseries seen not only `anomaly_score` metric was generated, but also `y` (actual values model saw during inference). See [the guide section for the details](https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/presets/#default)
panels.title: Raw Metric Values ($output_series)

list.description: Select the VictoriaMetrics data source that contains `anomaly_score` metrics produced by vmanomaly
list.label: Data Source
list.name: DS_VM

list.description:
The prefix for output metrics generated by `vmanomaly`, defined in `writer.metric_format.__name__`, 

Example: __name__: 'test_$VAR' will result in names 'test_anomaly_score', 'test_y', 'test_yhat', 'test_yhat_upper', etc. - put `test_` in the field for such metrics to be properly fetched in visualizations
list.label: Metrics Prefix
list.name: vmanomaly_prefix

list.description: Anomaly score threshold T that splits non-anomalous data points (if anomaly_score <= T) and anomalous data points (if anomaly_score > T). By default equals to 1.0, which is a value for all built-in models in `vmanomaly`. See FAQ section https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/faq/#what-is-anomaly-score for the details
list.label: Threshold
list.name: anomaly_score_threshold

list.description: Preset used for `vmanomaly`, e.g. `node_exporter`. If not specified in a config, defaults to `default`. See https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/presets/ for the details
list.label: Presets
list.name: preset

list.description: Scheduler alias, used in VictoriaMetrics Anomaly Detection configs, e.g. `periodic_1w_1m`. See https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/scheduler/ for the details
list.label: Schedulers
list.name: scheduler_alias

list.description: Model aliases, defined in a `models` section of a config - https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/models/
list.label: Models
list.name: model_alias

list.description: Add a `groupby` option to use in `by` clauses of metricsQL queries of (generalized) dashboard visualizations, e.g. to have more granular view instead of default `by ()` clause. Example: choose "model_alias" to group by `model_alias` label values.
list.label: Group by
list.name: groupby

list.description: Specify % of datapoints in a [$__interval] that has anomaly score > `Threshold` variable to filter timeseries in Local Anomaly Statistic section
list.label: Min. Anomaly%
list.name: anomaly_share

list.description: What series on raw metrics scale to show on local anomaly score statistic (defaults to `y` - raw metric values). Can be a multi-value subset of https://docs.victoriametrics.com/anomaly-detection/components/models/#vmanomaly-output - [`y`, `yhat`, `yhat_lower`, `yhat_upper`]
list.label: Show series
list.name: output_series

list.description: Ad hoc filters to apply to all queries of this dashboard, specified as a list of <label> <op> <value> triplets. See https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/dashboards/use-dashboards/#filter-dashboard-data for the details
list.label: Ad hoc filters
list.name: adhoc_filters

title: VictoriaMetrics - vmanomaly - anomaly statistics
